text: The aim of this open-label, fixed-sequence study was to investigate the potential of Echinacea purpurea, a commonly used botanical supplement, to interact with the boosted protease inhibitor darunavir-ritonavir.
label: Study
Herb name
Drug

text: Fifteen HIV-infected patients receiving antiretroviral therapy including darunavir-ritonavir (600/100 mg twice daily) for at least 4 weeks were included.
label: Cohort
Pathology
Drug
Amount
Frequency
Duration

text: E. purpurea root extract capsules were added to the antiretroviral treatment (500 mg every 6 h) from days 1 to 14.
label: Herb name
Extraction process
Herb part
Amount
Frequency
Duration

text: Darunavir concentrations in plasma were determined by high-performance liquid chromatography immediately before and 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 10, and 12 h after a morning dose of darunavir-ritonavir on days 0 (darunavir-ritonavir) and 14 (darunavir-ritonavir plus echinacea).
label: Drug
Parameter
Duration
Drug
Drug
Drug
Herb name

text: Individual darunavir pharmacokinetic parameters were calculated by noncompartmental analysis and compared between days 0 and 14 with the geometric mean ratio (GMR) and its 90% confidence interval (CI).
label: Drug
Duration

text: The median age was 49 (range, 43 to 67) years, and the body mass index was 24.2 (range, 18.7 to 27.5) kg/m
